meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be leached.
meanings.sent1: The leachabilities of the soil determine its fertility.
meanings.sent2: Farmers need to consider the leachabilities of different types of fertilizers.
meanings.sent3: The leachabilities of the sugar in my tea seem to make it disappear faster!
meanings.sent4: The leachabilities of knowledge from books enrich our minds.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the leachabilities of colors in paint helps artists create beautiful artwork.

meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to be leached.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the leachabilities of minerals in rocks.
meanings.sent2: The leachabilities of pollutants in water sources can have harmful effects.
meanings.sent3: The leachabilities of flavors in food can sometimes surprise our taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The leachabilities of emotions from memories can be therapeutic.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the leachabilities of scents in perfumes can lead to unique fragrances.
